timeline.message: Enforce LF as the newline character

timeline.bodyText:
I highly recommend to eliminate the trailing space. Trailing spaces are a style-smell, I would say. Git highlights it as an error when displaying a diff. IDEs can be configured to automatically strip off trailing white space on save.
I know this is a result of applying the maven plugin and I'd argue it's a bug. But note that it won't reintroduce the trailing white space if the Javadoc is already formatted correctly and contains the blank line after description.
timeline.author: yurloc
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -51,8 +51,9 @@ * The XML root element must be {@code }. *

* To read an XML benchmark configuration instead, use {@link #createFromXmlResource(String)}. + *

replies.bodyText:
Concrete example why neglecting the white space produced by the plugin will be a problem:
I have my IDE configured to strip trailing spaces on save and I use my IDE to format the code using a shortcut. So each time I'll edit and commit a source file, I'll produce a formatting noise by removing the trailing space (until it's eventually eradicated).
I'd find that quite annoying especially given that such situation can be easily avoided. Remember that the maven plugin is a safety net for contributors using exotic IDEs or unwilling to import our style.
replies.author: yurloc

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing this out, already fixed.
replies.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText: Radovan removed all trailing spaces in all these javadocs
replies.author: ge0ffrey

diff --git a/optaplanner-benchmark/src/main/java/org/optaplanner/benchmark/api/PlannerBenchmarkFactory.java b/optaplanner-benchmark/src/main/java/org/optaplanner/benchmark/api/PlannerBenchmarkFactory.java index 0179fe972..18860ab4b 100644 --- a/optaplanner-benchmark/src/main/java/org/optaplanner/benchmark/api/PlannerBenchmarkFactory.java +++ b/optaplanner-benchmark/src/main/java/org/optaplanner/benchmark/api/PlannerBenchmarkFactory.java @@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ public abstract class PlannerBenchmarkFactory { * The XML root element must be {@code }. *

* To read an XML benchmark configuration instead, use {@link #createFromXmlResource(String)}. - * + * * @param solverConfigResource never null, a classpath resource * as defined by {@link ClassLoader#getResource(String)} */

timeline.bodyText: The style allows lines longer than 120 chars -> GitHub diff windows with scrollbars.
timeline.author: yurloc

timeline.bodyText: Not nice. And it violates Checkstyle's GenericWhitespace.
timeline.author: yurloc

replies.bodyText:
I think that the explicit type argument itself is not nice - since Java 8, type inference is able to handle it [1]. I would rather remove it completely.
[1] https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/generics/genTypeInference.html
replies.author: rsynek

timeline.bodyText: Impossible to break line around assignment operator -> forces to violate line length limit.

timeline.bodyText: @rsynek Another example of removing "manual" line break of a different type. It's impossible to insert a line break anywhere on this line other than inside the parentheses around method parameters.
timeline.author: yurloc

timeline.bodyText: @rsynek Example of removing "manual" line break of different type. It's not allowed to break line around the arrow token.
timeline.author: yurloc
